channel.title: Simple instruction editor (at runtime)
channel.description:
hay. It's me again with another javaagent!!!1
Well this time basically its a javagent that uses the Instrumentationz "[url=http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/lang/instrument/Instrumentation.html#redefineClasses%28java.lang.instrument.ClassDefinition...%29]redefineClasses[/url]" method to allow you to edit method instructions during runtime.
Umm. I guess you would call this a "beta ver 0.1micropenis" version (but that sounds gay) so it isn't that useful as of yet. It would be pretty madd if it had a instruction searcher thing (i'll let you add that yourself ;)).
[img]http://img4.imageshack.us/img4/7127/reallycoolapp.jpg[/img]
The image above should pretty much explain the whole thing. It's pretty simple. All you have to do is editor instructions in the table and then click the "SAVE METHOD" button when your done with all your modifications.
Most of the instructions are handled (yeh, I know it sounds like a bit of a ripoff but I couldnt be bothered adding the boring ones!!!). If you get a VerrifyError or ClassFileError it means you fucked up bigtime. + a billion other "unforeseen" errors
I imagine it would be quite useful when debugging shit in runescape :). Well anyway download and have fun :):)
p.s. I hope my wankster typing hasn't put anyone off :|

item.title: Simple instruction editor (at runtime)
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“marluxia, post:5, topic:328457”][quote author=shangtsung1 link=topic=424839.msg3120074#msg3120074 date=1265466234]
components are in some sort of tab, that has no name ?
[/quote]

ye, it turns out that the tabs don’t even work- because premain is only called once per JVM instance not when you start the applet…

Interesting, does it support adding new instructions or only edit existing ones? In any case you should add another big fat button called “INSERT PRINTLINE”, then let you specify what text to output and/or possibly local variables as well)

it supports both. yea I was thinking of doing something like that :):)[/quote]Awesome, then this tool could prove quite useful for debugging, especially for me as i’m making an event based bot

Rep++ for you good sir

Read full topic
